div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-c5RTEf purZT-AhqUyc-c5RTEf pSzOP-AhqUyc-c5RTEf jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque

span.span: Elite Guards Lead Section 10 All-State Hoop Picks

Four elite senior guards in Chateaugay's Jonah McDonald, OFA's MeSean Johnson, Madrid-Waddington's Brennan Harmer and Harrisville's Jadon Sillivan and OFA center Jackson Jones led a strong Northern Athletic Conference/Section 10 representation on the Small School selections on the New York State Sportswriters All-Stat

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: As our time of social distancing continues we want to share with you some important resources that may be of use to you.

We understand that as time goes on, and individuals are waiting for stimulus checks and having difficulty with unemployment claims, there is increased financial strain. There is assistance available to members of our community. Community Connections of Franklin County can assist with helping you to get essential items such as food, personal hygiene items, diapers, prescriptions and pet food, as well as other items. If you would like to request assistance, please call Loretta Fowler at 497-6611, ext 2300 or email a member of the counseling department:

ul.li: Susan Jones-King s.jonesking@chateaugaycsd.org
Bruce Gugliotta b.gugliotta@chateaugaycsd.org
Danielle Matthews d.matthews@chateaugaycsd.org

div.p: We will connect you with someone from Community Connections. All referrals are kept strictly confidential.

The Counseling Department at CCS would like to do everything we can do to help you with the emotional toll this time is taking on all of us. We have a school closure Guidance Corner on the CCS website. There is a tab for this page along the top of the home page. Each day we share information that we hope will help both you and your children through this trying time. We have been and will continue to post short videos and other information that we think will be helpful. If you have concerns that you would like to discuss with a member of the counseling department, please reach out to us at the emails above.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc

span.span: ‘The Phantom of the Opera’ will stream for free on Friday
Andrew Lloyd Webber’s hits are rolling out on YouTube.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: This is your very proud principal, Mrs. Calnon. I hope that you and your family enjoyed a wonderful Easter together.
Parents we wanted to let you know that report cards, progress notes and AIS Reports were mailed home to families earlier today.

As I previously shared, Per Governor Cuomo's directions, we will continue to provide instruction to our students this week. Our spring break was scheduled from April 10th-April 17th. The Governor has asked that instruction continue during this time. Parents, please remember that this week was our scheduled Spring Break and your child may need a break from their school work. CCS prides itself on having rigorous academic expectations for our students. During this period of school closure, we are focused on our academic programming but we are more concerned for your child’s social and emotional well-being. Please hold your child accountable for their school work but at the same time ensure that your child has healthy breaks, if needed. Food distribution will also continue to take place this week.

Parents, I know that this is a challenging time for your child and for you. Please remember that the most important thing that you should be doing each day is reading. Please continue to have your child read, read, read! We hope that our students are enjoying a good book for at least 20 minutes each day. Our Pre-K through grade 5 teachers will be sending home another set of instructional materials on Monday, April 20th. Please have your child work to complete the previous instructional packet this week. Remember, our teachers love to see your child’s work. Please take pictures of your child’s work and email it to your child’s teacher, post the work in the classroom Facebook group or post the work in the Google Classroom. We want your child to be proud of the work that they are completing and as educators we want to be able to provide them with feedback so that our students are able to continually improve their skills. Parents, thank you for working so closely with our educators during this difficult time.

As I have said before, please go to the CCS website to participate in activities that are being provided from our Special Area teachers. Our Physical Education department continues to provide really fun daily exercises. Mrs. Hunt, our Music teacher has been posting songs and activities for our students to participate in. Mrs. Hamilton-Moore has a weekly Art lesson that our students are able to complete and Mrs. Campbell does provide a daily read aloud and post an activity in her Google Classroom. There are so many wonderful opportunities for our children! Please contact either myself or your child’s teacher if you are in need of anything. We are here to assist in any way that we can. Please, be well.
Mrs. Calnon

iframe.aria-label: Drive, Essential Child Care Referral flyer.pdf

div.aria-label: Drive, Essential Child Care Referral flyer.pdf

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Boys and girls, I have a very important writing assignment for you this week! I know that you are up for the challenge. We often talk about how we can be of service to others and the importance of having a grateful heart. Boys and girls, there are three facilities in our community that are in need of some of our service. The people that live at these facilities are unable to have any visitors at this time. That is very difficult! I'm sure that they are missing their families. Little Bulldogs, I need your help! Let's write letters and send beautiful pictures to the residents at these facilities. I'm sure that our letters and pictures will help to brighten the spirits of the residents of the facilities. Our little Bulldogs take care of our community and all of our community members. Thank you for your help Bulldogs! Please find the addresses of the facilities below. I miss you!
Love, Mrs. Calnon
45 Lewis Rd.
Chateaugay, NY 12920

h3.div: Franklin County Chapter, NYS ARC, Inc.

div.p: Chasm Road 10 County Rt 35
Chateaugay, NY
52 Church Street
Chateaugay, NY 12920

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h3.div: Pen Pals - Letters to Mrs. Calnon

div.p: Wow!! Boys and girls, I can’t believe how many letters I have received! Thank you for making me such a proud principal! I love reading about all of the fun things that you are doing with your families. I was pleased to read that many of you are reading each day, completing your instructional packet or your work in google classroom and even working on I-ready! Keep up the great work boys and girls. I am sitting down tonight to complete my homework- writing each of you a letter! This week I will have a new writing assignment for you. Check back tomorrow for all of the details. I miss you little Bulldogs ️

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque

div.p: She has created her own YouTube Channel and an Instagram account. Follow her now and check out her videos.
Miss Thomas is running a Google Class for everyone. She posts fun videos, questions and the discussions are so fun. It is open to all. Join her class with the code: u7enwne

Mrs. Campbell has set up her own Google Classroom with the code: 6mhtqud . She will post some writing prompts and ask questions about what everyone has been reading. Sounds fun. Add her class from your existing Google Classroom page.

div.p: School Closure Guidance Corner

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Students can still get their working papers. Some guidance has been provided to school to help in this matter. If any student is interested in acquiring their working papers, please contact Chandra Henderson at c.henderson@chateaugaycsd.org or 518-497-6611 ext 2401

p.strong: Alternative Process for Issuing Working Papers During COVID-19 School Closures

p.em: Parents/guardians and minors complete the appropriate application form and email it to the district or school’s Certificating Officer. Fillable PDF versions of the AT-17 Application for Employment Certificate and AT-22 Application for Employment Permit are now available on NYSED’s Employment of Minors website. These forms allow digital signatures.

The Certificating Officer schedules a video call with the minor, and if required, the parent or guardian. During this video call, the minor presents required documentation as per the Certificating Officers Manual. Certificating Officers may then complete the working card, sign it, and mail it to the minor. The minor should sign the card upon receipt. The requirement that the minor sign the card in the presence of the certificating officer is temporarily waived for the duration of New York’s COVID-19 school closures. Certificating Officers must continue to use approved working cards.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Students in grade 8 through 11 should visit the 7-12 School Closure Page for instructions about registering for classes for next year. Mr. G has made some videos for you along with course descriptions.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-OwsYgb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: You are having a senior year like no other! We think it is important for everyone to have a copy of their Senior Year Yearbook. The CCS CAPES Team can provide financial assistance to help you purchase your yearbook. If you would like to request assistance, email Mrs. Beaudin at s.beaudin@chateaugaycsd.org or Ms. Jones-King at s.jonesking@chateaugaycsd.org

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Did you know that one of Mrs. Calnon’s favorite things when she was a little girl was to receive a letter in the mail? It always made me feel so special. Boys and girls, I would love you to send me a letter either in the mail or by email. I promise I will respond! I would love to hear about all of the things that you have been doing during our time apart. I miss you very much, Little Bulldogs!
Love, Mrs. Calnon

ul.li: Nicole Calnon
PO Box 205
Chateaugay, NY 12920

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc

div.p: Thank you, Mrs. Jones-King for sharing this picture of a heart rainbow. This is from Johnny and Irelynn's mother's house. They are being displayed as a sign of unity all across the country. Maybe they will continue to show up in Chateaugay. We are all in this together.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc

div.p: Mrs. Gardiner is sending out a plea during our time apart to anyone that would like to share a short narrative, drawing, or picture that she can add to the yearbook since this school year is like no other. This would be one way to share this memory of a lifetime, that hopefully never happens again. Please share your ideas with her by April 10th. She is looking forward to hearing from you!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: I put some of the longer items and archived items in Google Doc format to help clean up the main page.

li.a: Free and Reduced Meal Program - Updated for March 2020

ul.li: Child Care Coordinating Council of the North Country - "If you are considered essential personnel and you are in need of child care, you can call our agency at 518-561-4999 and dial 106 for Courtney."

li.a: State Education Department and New York's Public Television Stations Announce Expanded Remote Learning During Statewide School Closure

ul.li: NYSUT Resource List - ideas and activities for all subject and ages.
Age of Learning Resources - Free sites set up by Mrs. Fowler
Empowering and Protecting Your Family During the COVID-19 Pandemic - March 22, 2020 - a long, but informative video. Dr. David Price, Weill Cornell Medical Center, https://vimeo.com/399733860

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h3.div: From Mrs. Fowler - I am also sharing information I received from a Franklin County Update. The highlighted information shares a new SCAM regarding stimulus checks.

ul.li: Franklin County has 5 positive cases. Individuals are in quarantine/isolation and contact tracing is occurring for those who have tested positive.
Franklin County has a total of 61 on Isolation/Quarantine status.
92 negative tests have come back.
Franklin County Public Health continues to work in collaboration with NY State Department of Corrections and Community Supervision (DOCCS) and neighboring counties.

Franklin County would like to notify residents that police are investigating a scam regarding stimulus checks. It involves a phone call from someone claiming to be from the IRS trying to confirm their bank information so they can directly deposit the $1,200 check. THIS IS A SCAM! DO NOT GIVE THEM YOUR INFORMATION.

Franklin County stresses Stay at home, social/physical distancing, all preventative measures for hygiene and sanitation. You should assume every person might be a carrier and practice the recommendations. Businesses are required to put plans in place to avoid social contact that is less than 6’.
